intro: Psephellus eugenii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in bright, indirect light. Its foliage is often velvety and comes in shades of green, silver, or variegated patterns. Psephellus eugenii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
